actor_awards.notes: Nicknamed 'Satchmo', 'Satch', and 'Pops'. He was a foundational influence in jazz, shifting the focus of the music from collective improvisation to solo performance. Won a Grammy for his vocal performance of 'Hello, Dolly!' in 1964.

filmography.title: High Society
filmography.role_description: He plays himself as the leader of the jazz band hired to play at the wedding, narrating the story through song.
filmography.plot: A musical remake of 'The Philadelphia Story' in which a wealthy woman's wedding plans are complicated by the arrival of her ex-husband and a tabloid reporter.

filmography.title: Hello, Dolly!
filmography.role_description: The bandleader at the Harmonia Gardens restaurant who welcomes Dolly back with the title song.
filmography.plot: A matchmaker travels to Yonkers to find a partner for a half-millionaire, but she secretly intends to marry him herself.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Sound, Best Music (Score)

filmography.title: The Five Pennies
filmography.role_description: He plays himself as a friend and musical peer to cornet player Red Nichols, performing classic duets.
filmography.plot: The biographical story of jazz cornet player Red Nichols, his career, and his family struggles.

filmography.title: Paris Blues
filmography.role_description: A famous American jazz trumpeter visiting Paris who has a 'battle of the bands' with the protagonist.
filmography.plot: Two American jazz musicians living in Paris find their romantic lives complicated by the arrival of two American tourists.

filmography.title: A Man Called Adam
filmography.role_description: A veteran jazz musician who tries to help a troubled younger trumpet player.
filmography.plot: A talented but self-destructive jazz musician struggles with racism and guilt over a past tragedy.

filmography.title: Cabin in the Sky
filmography.role_description: One of Lucifer's minions who tries to execute an idea to destroy the protagonist's soul.
filmography.plot: A compulsive gambler dies during a fight but is given six months to redeem his soul.

filmography.title: New Orleans
filmography.role_description: He plays himself in a semi-fictionalized account of the birth of jazz in New Orleans.
filmography.plot: A gambling hall owner and a classical singer fall in love against the backdrop of the rise of jazz music.

filmography.title: The Glenn Miller Story
filmography.role_description: He appears as himself, jamming with Glenn Miller in a Harlem nightclub.
filmography.plot: The life story of big band leader Glenn Miller, from his early struggles to his death in World War II.

filmography.title: Pennies from Heaven
filmography.role_description: A musician who performs the title song and interacts with Bing Crosby's character.
filmography.plot: A wandering singer befriends a young girl and her grandfather, trying to help them out of their troubles.

filmography.title: Going Places
filmography.role_description: A groom who sings 'Jeepers Creepers' to a horse to make it calm down.
filmography.plot: A sporting goods salesman poses as a famous jockey to boost his sales.

filmography.title: A Song Is Born
filmography.role_description: One of the famous jazz musicians who helps a group of professors understand modern music.
filmography.plot: A group of music professors researching the history of music get a crash course in jazz from a singer on the run.

filmography.title: Glory Alley
filmography.role_description: The trainer of a boxer who also serves as a guide for the boxer's blind father.
filmography.plot: A boxer quits the ring before a big fight and struggles to regain his reputation and the love of his girlfriend.

filmography.title: The Strip
filmography.role_description: He plays himself, performing at a nightclub where the aspiring drummer protagonist works.
filmography.plot: A drummer trying to make it in Hollywood gets mixed up with mobsters and a dancer.

filmography.title: Every Day's a Holiday
filmography.role_description: He appears as himself, performing musical numbers in this Mae West vehicle.
filmography.plot: A con artist returns to New York to help the police chief clean up the city and clear her name.

filmography.title: Artists and Models
filmography.role_description: He performs with his orchestra in this musical comedy.
filmography.plot: The head of an advertising agency tries to find the perfect model for a silverware campaign.

filmography.title: Doctor Rhythm
filmography.role_description: A musician performing in the film's musical segments.
filmography.plot: A doctor poses as a policeman to help a friend and ends up guarding a wealthy woman.

filmography.title: Jam Session
filmography.role_description: One of several famous musicians featured in this musical revue film.
filmography.plot: A woman wins a dance contest and tries to get Hollywood to listen to her ideas for a movie.

filmography.title: Atlantic City
filmography.role_description: He appears as himself, performing in the Atlantic City setting.
filmography.plot: A vaudeville promoter tries to turn Atlantic City into a major entertainment destination.

filmography.title: Pillow to Post
filmography.role_description: He performs with his orchestra in this wartime romantic comedy.
filmography.plot: A saleswoman struggling to find a room during World War II convinces a soldier to pose as her husband.

filmography.title: The Beat Generation
filmography.role_description: He appears as himself in this crime drama attempting to capitalize on the beatnik culture.
filmography.plot: A detective hunts a serial rapist who targets housewives, while also dealing with the beatnik scene.

filmography.title: Jazz on a Summer's Day
filmography.role_description: He is one of the featured performers in this seminal concert documentary.
filmography.plot: A documentary filming the 1958 Newport Jazz Festival in Rhode Island.

filmography.title: Satchmo the Great
filmography.role_description: The subject of this documentary which follows his tours in Europe and Africa.
filmography.plot: A documentary following Louis Armstrong and his band on their extensive tours around the world.

filmography.title: Rhapsody in Black and Blue
filmography.role_description: He plays himself appearing in a dream sequence as the King of Jazzmania.
filmography.plot: A husband who loves jazz is knocked unconscious by his wife and dreams he is in a jazz kingdom ruled by Louis Armstrong.

filmography.title: When the Boys Meet the Girls
filmography.role_description: He appears as himself in this musical remake of the Gershwin musical 'Girl Crazy'.
filmography.plot: A wealthy playboy is sent to a Nevada ranch to keep him out of trouble, where he turns the place into a dude ranch.

filmography.title: Ex-Flame
filmography.role_description: An uncredited role as the leader of the band in his film debut.
filmography.plot: Based on the novel 'East Lynne', a woman leaves her husband and children for a lover, only to return years later in disguise.
